    How to link Environment to SupplyChain365

    How to link your environment to SupplyChain365

    Now the SupplyChain365 extension is installed. You can also install supplychain365 extension from Microsoft app source website.

    The next step is to link SupplyChain365 to your Business Central environment. In your Microsoft Edge browser, open a new tab and go to https://portal.supplychain365.net/.

    1. Login with your Microsoft work account. Only a user with admin rights can link environments.
    2. Go to the admin menu > Users and grant permission on behalf of your organization. You only have to do this once in the Users page. Karel can import the office users of the organization. As you can see, Karel is an admin user.
    3. Now go to the admin menu. Select environment and click Register environment. A link code will be generated. Next,
    4. click â€˜Copy to clipboardâ€™. Go to the business Central window and open the SupplyChain365 Role Center.
    5. In the Supply Chain 365 Role center, go to setup in the main menu and click Link Portal.
    6. Now paste copied link from clipboard by pressing CTRL + V, linked successfully

    now you can use SupplyChain365 in business central.

    Why we love Cookies

    We use cookies to try and give you a better experience in Supplychain365.

    You can learn more about what kind of cookies we use, why, and how from our Privacy policy. If you hate cookies, or are just on a diet, you can disable them altogether too. Just note that the Freshdesk service is pretty big on some cookies (we love the choco-chip ones), and some portions of Freshdesk may not work properly if you disable cookies.

    We’ll also assume you agree to the way we use cookies and are ok with it as described in our Privacy policy, unless you choose to disable them altogether through your browser.
